name: Tinnitus

rating_logic.summary: Schedular maximum is generally 10% for recurrent tinnitus (single evaluation rule).

evidence_checklist: Current symptoms described (frequency, impact on sleep/focus)
Medical/audiology notes mentioning tinnitus (if available)
Service event/exposure history (e.g., hazardous noise) documented in records if it exists
Treatment history (hearing protection, audiology visits, etc.)
disclaimer: Educational CFR mapping only. Not legal advice or representation.

name: Limitation of Flexion of the Knee
evidence_checklist: Range-of-motion measurements (flexion) from exam or treatment notes
Pain with motion / flare-up notes (how often, how severe)
Functional impact (stairs, standing, walking, kneeling)
Imaging and treatment history (PT, injections, braces) if documented
disclaimer: Educational CFR mapping only. Not legal advice or representation.

name: Paralysis of the Sciatic Nerve (Sciatica)

rating_logic.summary: Rating is based on severity (mild → complete).

excerpts.label: Rating criteria excerpt
excerpts.text: Mild incomplete paralysis of the sciatic nerve warrants a 10 percent evaluation. Moderate incomplete paralysis warrants 20 percent...

evidence_checklist: Symptoms + pattern (radiating pain, numbness, weakness)
Neuro findings (reflexes, strength, sensation) if documented
disclaimer: Educational CFR mapping only. Not legal advice or representation.

name: Hearing Loss

rating_logic.summary: Rating uses puretone thresholds + speech discrimination to find Roman numerals (Tables VI/VIa) and combine them (Table VII).

evidence_checklist: Audiogram results (puretone thresholds at 1000/2000/3000/4000 Hz)
Maryland CNC speech discrimination scores
Hearing-related functional impact (work/communication)
Noise exposure history if documented
disclaimer: Educational CFR mapping only. Not legal advice or representation.

name: Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)

cfr.title: General Rating Formula for Mental Disorders (PTSD)

rating_logic.summary: PTSD is evaluated under the General Rating Formula (0–100%) based on occupational and social impairment and symptoms.

evidence_checklist: Mental health diagnosis and treatment notes (therapy/medication) if present
Symptom frequency/severity and functional impact (work, relationships, sleep)
Stressors/events documented where possible (records or statements)
Any relevant exam results (e.g., C&P mental health exam) if performed
disclaimer: Educational CFR mapping only. Not legal advice or representation.

name: Migraine Headaches

rating_logic.summary: Ratings depend on frequency and severity of prostrating attacks.

levels.level: Characteristic prostrating attacks averaging one in 2 months
Characteristic prostrating attacks occurring on average once a month
Very frequent completely prostrating and prolonged attacks with severe economic inadaptability

evidence_checklist: Frequency and severity of headaches documented in medical records or statements
Notes describing prostrating attacks (needing to lie down, inability to function)
Impact on work, concentration, or daily functioning
Treatment history (medication, neurology visits, ER visits if applicable)
disclaimer: Educational CFR mapping only. Not legal advice or representation.

name: Sleep Apnea (including obstructive sleep apnea)

rating_logic.summary: Sleep apnea ratings depend largely on CPAP use and respiratory complications.

evidence_checklist: Sleep study confirming diagnosis
CPAP prescription or treatment documentation
Functional impact such as daytime fatigue
disclaimer: Educational CFR mapping only. Not legal advice or representation.

name: Asthma (Bronchial)

rating_logic.summary: Asthma ratings consider pulmonary testing results and medication use.

evidence_checklist: Pulmonary function testing results
Medication usage history
Frequency of exacerbations
disclaimer: Educational CFR mapping only. Not legal advice or representation.
